events.title: Anne Boleyn Executed
events.description: Anne Boleyn, the Queen of England and second wife of King Henry VIII, was executed on charges of treason, adultery, and incest.
events.significance: Her execution marked a pivotal moment in the English Reformation and drastically impacted the monarchy and religious landscape of England.

events.title: Irish Potato Famine Refugees Arrive in Canada
events.description: The first significant group of Irish refugees from the Great Famine began arriving in Canada seeking relief from starvation and economic collapse.
events.significance: This event led to a major demographic shift in Canada and highlighted the widespread human impacts of the famine.

events.title: Mariner 1 Launch Failure
events.description: NASA's Mariner 1 spacecraft, designed to fly by Venus, was destroyed shortly after launch due to a guidance system failure.
events.significance: This failure emphasized the challenges of early space exploration and led to improvements in spacecraft guidance systems.

events.title: Mustafa Kemal Atatürk Lands at Samsun
events.description: Mustafa Kemal Atatürk landed at Samsun, marking the beginning of the Turkish War of Independence.
events.significance: This event is considered the start of the formation of modern Turkey and Atatürk is celebrated as the founder of the Turkish Republic.

events.title: Hubble Space Telescope Launched
events.description: The Hubble Space Telescope, a major space-based observatory, was launched into orbit by the Space Shuttle Discovery.
events.significance: The Hubble has vastly expanded our understanding of the universe through its detailed observations and has become one of the most important tools in modern astronomy.
